metadata.title: CVE-2024-1312 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in the Linux kernel's Memory Managementsubsystem when a user wins two races at the same time with a fail in themas_prev_slot function. This issue could allow a local user to crash thesystem.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-1312` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-15-generic - 6.5.0-15.15
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-15-generic - 6.5.0-15.15
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-15-generic-64k - 6.5.0-15.15
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-15.15').
linux-aws package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-gcp package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support').
linux-laptop package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-lowlatency package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-oracle package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-raspi package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-starfive package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
